pullRequest.title: [Enhancement] Improve feedback and grading generation
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I updated multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features (with a high test coverage)

Motivation and Context


Preparing the grading and feedback system of programming exercises to be extended with the new static code analysis configuration of #2086.
Description


Cleanup and refactor feedback generation in bamboo and jenkins service.

Moved generation of test-case-feedback from BambooService to FeedbackService (now in-line with sca feedback generation)
Remove retrieveLatestResult method used for the 'trigger-failed-build' endpoint

the retrieved result had different information than the result sent to Artemis via the updated bamboo notification plugin
therefore the score generation would be false
the endpoint now always triggers a new build




Add ProgrammingExerciseGradingService and ProgrammingExerciseGradingResource to handle grading specific api requests and score generation

Most of the code is moved and adapted from the TestCaseService / -Resource classes.
Moved processNewProgrammingExerciseResult from ResultService to GradingService
Moved updateResult and updateAllResults from TestCaseService to GradingService
Moved reset and re-evaluate endpoints from TestCaseResource to GradingResource


We do not yet include static code analysis in the score generation.

Steps for Testing

Check that the grading system for programming exercises still works as before.
Since this affects CI-specific code, please test this for both setups - Bamboo and Jenkins (TS1 / TS2).

Log in to Artemis
Create a Programming Exericse
Adjust the TestCase Configuration via the Grading page.
Participate in the exercise
Check that the score is calculated correctly and all test case feedback is displayed correctly.

Also test:

Re-evaluating the results via the grading page.
Triggering all builds via the grading page.
Resetting the grading config via the grading page.
Triggering a failed build as a student (Stop the build on bamboo/jenkins and refresh the page to see the red button).
Tests after due date
Sequential tests
Test cases with bonus Points
Participation after due date should still be possible with an unrated result
Manual results (inline feedback feature)

Test Coverage


FeedbackService.java: 95%
ProgrammingExerciseGradingService.java: 94%
ProgrammingExerciseTestCaseService.java: 99%
ProgrammingExerciseGradingResource.java: 97%
ProgrammingExerciseTestCaseResource.java: 94%

commit.message: improve feedback generation in bamboo service
fix feedback generation in jenkins service
remove non-functional retrieveLatestResult methods in CIServices
add grading service and grading resource
adjust tests and fix code issues

nodes.bodyText:
Important: FeedbackService (and all other services) must be independent of Bamboo specifics. It should only depend on the more general ContinuousIntegrationService. This is an important design principle in Artemis to avoid issues with other VC / CI systems (Gitlab, Jenkins) and future implementations of those.
I think you have two options:

Move this method into Bamboo service
Find an abstraction for BambooTestJobDTO that can be used for Jenkins, Bamboo and potentially all other CI Services

The 2nd option is used for the StaticCodeAnalysisReportDTO which is basically independent from the concrete CI system. However, this does not mean that you also need to choose it here

commit.message: change signature of createFeedbackFromTestJob and use also in JenkinsService

nodes.bodyText:
The method name is now misleading as there is no test job any more.
I suggest to use a different one
Is this true? Maybe we better write something else here.
Just a note / to-do for a followup: Improve this to include multiple lines.

See #1659

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    if (result.getFeedbacks().stream().noneMatch(feedback -> feedback.isPositive() == Boolean.FALSE
          
          
            
                    if (result.getFeedbacks().stream().noneMatch(feedback -> Boolean.FALSE.equals(feedback.isPositive())
Is there a reason why we use two nested forEach calls here instead of the flatMap and collect that was there before?

commit.message: use normal for each loop instead of .forEach()

nodes.bodyText: Codacy found an issue: Avoid really long methods.
Codacy found an issue: Avoid long parameter lists.

nodes.bodyText: I think the comment is misplaced here
I would prefer to extract the service call and store it in one variable. It makes it more readable. You did the same a few lines below, or you change it there as well, then it is consistent. :)
